intro: Pimpinella gedrosiaca, commonly known as the Gedrosian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Pimpinella gedrosiaca is adapted to survive in harsh environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
